page.title: 01Birker Fell
page.content: The northern end of the ridge form Black Combe is called Birker Fell. It drops to the sea on the west, to the Duddon Valley to the east and to the river Esk to the north. The main summit is Yoadcastle, and Rocky Knoll, 1597 feet above sea level. The square also contains a fine farn, Devolce Water, which lies in a lonely hollow surrounded by the fells. There is a small boathouse and good fishing in the lake. There are many mounds and ancient remains from an early British settlement at Barnscar.
